page.title: Negative Constructions - Adverbial and Auxiliary elements
page.introduction: In this section, the examples you gave earlier of negative temporal and locative advebs and auxiliaries are repeated below. Then you are asked to put these words into sentences. We are interested in examples without any negative nominal phrases or negative pronouns, such as the following:

EnglishExample.exItem: Nowhere he looked did he find the box.
John could not find the treasure.

form.prompt:
In
Adverbs and AdvP you stated that your language does not express the negative temporal adverbs (meaning ‘no when’) as a separate word, but rather as a verbal affix. In that section, you gave the following examples of the negative temporal affix(es) attached to verbs. You may add any additional data that you think of now.

In
Adverbs and AdvP you stated that your language only expresses the negative temporal ideas by using a positive temporal adverb written as a separate word along with the negative verbal affix. In that section, you gave the following examples of such temporal adverbs and negative verbs. You may add any additional data that you think of now.

In
Adverbs and AdvP you keyed the following examples of negative temporal adverbs. You may add any additional data that you think of now.
Examples of the negative temporal affix(es) attached to verbs:
form.instruction: Be sure to key the features negative temporal on any new affix(es) that you added.
form.prompt: Examples of the negative temporal adverbs alone:
Examples of temporal adverbs with negative verbs alone:
form.instruction: Be sure to key the feature negative on any new affix(es) that express negation on the verb that you added.
Be sure to key the features negative temporal on any new words that you added, and also make sure they will have the category Adv.
form.prompt:
In
Adverbs and AdvP you stated that your language expresses the negative temporal adverbs (meaning ‘no when’) using a negative word that occurs with the positive temporal adverbs. In that section, you gave the following examples. You may add any additional data that you think of now.
Examples of the negative temporal adverb phrases formed by adding the negative word to the positive temporal adverbs:

In
Adverbs and AdvP you stated that your language expresses the negative temporal adverbs (meaning ‘no when’) using a negative affix atached to the positive temporal adverbs. In that section, you gave the following examples. You may add any additional data that you think of now.
Examples of the negative temporal adverbs formed by adding the negative affix to the positive temporal adverbs:
Now take at least one of the negative temporal examples in the above box and use it in a complete sentence where the subject and object are positive here:

In
Adverbs and AdvP - Locative Adverbs you stated that your language does not express the negative locative adverbs (meaning ‘nowhere’) as a separate word, but rather as a verbal affix. In that section, you gave the following examples of the negative locative affix(es) attached to verbs. You may add any additional data that you think of now.

In
Adverbs and AdvP - Locative Adverbs you stated that your language only expresses the negative locative ideas by using a positive locative adverb written as a separate word along with the negative verbal affix. In that section, you gave the following examples of such locative adverbs and negative verbs. You may add any additional data that you think of now.

In
Adverbs and AdvP - Locative Adverbs you keyed the following examples of negative locative adverbs. You may add any additional data that you think of now.
Examples of the negative locative affix(es) attached to verbs:
form.instruction: Be sure to key the features negative locative on any new affix(es) that you added.
form.prompt: Examples of the negative locative adverbs alone:
Examples of locative adverbs with negative verbs alone:
form.instruction: Be sure to key the feature negative on any new affix(es) that express negation on the verb that you added.
Be sure to key the features negative locative on any new words that you added, and also make sure they will have the category Adv.
form.prompt:
In
Adverbs and AdvP you stated that your language expresses the negative locative adverbs (meaning ‘nowhere’) using a negative word that occurs with the positive locative adverbs. In that section, you gave the following examples. You may add any additional data that you think of now.
Examples of the negative locative adverb phrases formed by adding the negative word to the positive locative adverbs:

In
Adverbs and AdvP you stated that your language expresses the negative locative adverbs (meaning ‘nowhere’) using a negative affix atached to the positive locative adverbs. In that section, you gave the following examples. You may add any additional data that you think of now.
Examples of the negative locative adverbs formed by adding the negative affix to the positive locative adverbs:
Now take at least one of the negative locative examples in the above box and use it in a complete sentence where the subject and object are positive here:

radioGroup.prompt: Looking back at the full sentence examples you have given, is the verb or auxiliary required to be negative when there is a separate negative adverb?
radioGroup.radio: Yes, a negative adverb is not allowed without also having a negative verb or auxiliary
No, the verb or auxiliary is not required to be negative when there is a negative adverb

form.prompt:
In
Basic, Single-clause Sentences - Auxiliaries you keyed the following examples of negative auxiliaries that are written as separate words. You may add any additional data that you think of now.
Examples of the negative auxiliary word(s) alone:
form.instruction: Be sure to key the feature negative on any new words that you added, and also make sure they will have the category Aux.
form.prompt: Now use at least one of the above negative auxiliaries in a complete sentence where the subject and object are positive and key it here:

In
Basic, Single-clause Sentences - Auxiliaries you keyed the following examples of negative auxiliary affixes attached to an auxiliary. You may add any additional data that you think of now.
Examples of the negative auxiliary affix(es) attached to an auxiliary:
form.instruction: Be sure to key the feature negative on any new affix(es) that you added.
form.prompt: Now use at least one of the above examples of a negative auxiliary affix attached to an auxiliary in a complete sentence where the subject and object are positive and key it here:

In
Basic, Single-clause Sentences - Auxiliaries you keyed the following examples of the negative verbal affix(es) attached to a verb. You may add any additional data that you think of now.
Examples of the negative verbal affix(es) attached to a verb:
form.instruction: Be sure to key the feature negative on any new affix(es) that you added.
form.prompt: Now take several of the examples of negative verbs above and use each in a complete sentence where it is the only negative word or phrase here:

radioGroup.prompt: Looking back at the full sentence examples you have given, is the verb required to be negative when there is a negative auxiliary element?
radioGroup.radio: Yes, a negative auxiliary is not allowed without the verb also being negative
No, the verb is not required to be negative when there is a negative auxiliary
